page.title: 19FOOTBALL MATCH,NEWTON MEARNS
page.content: In general most people go to see football matches on public transport i.e. bus train or subway. Others take their cars and park them in the carpark. When they get there they pay to take a seat in the stand or they stand in the terrace. Before the match starts a band plays to the crowd while the teams warm-up. The object is for one team to score more goals than the other by kicking a ball into the opposition's net. Each team has eleven players. When a goal is scored the supporters shout and sing for their own team. The supporters are separated by fences to stop fights between the rival supporters. At halftime the supporters have pies and bovril. After 1O mins the game restarts, at the end the supporters leave and go back home.
